跌.definition: to fall; to tumble; to trip; (of prices etc) to drop; Taiwan pr. [die2]

跌倒.definition: to tumble; to fall; fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)

跌停.definition: (of a stock price) to fall to the daily lower limit (resulting in a suspension of trade in the stock)

跌停板.definition: daily lower limit on the price of a stock

跌幅.definition: decline (in value); extent of a drop

跌打損傷.definition: injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc

跌撲.definition: to tumble; to stumble and fall

跌斷.definition: to fall and fracture (a leg, vertebra etc)

跌水.definition: drop of height in waterway; staircase of waterfalls

跌破.definition: (of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level); to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall

跌腳捶胸.definition: lit. stamping and beating the chest (idiom); fig. angry or stressed about sth

跌跤.definition: to fall down; to take a fall

跌進.definition: to fall into; to dip below a certain level
